title: Obese man 'raped woman he met online who feared he was "too fat" to share bed'
text:

A morbidly obese man raped a woman who feared they "wouldn't fit in the same bed," a court heard today.

Christopher Schubert turned up on the woman's doorstep after chatting on Match.com.

But the woman, a separated mum, was unaware Schubert was morbidly obese and rejected the idea of a sexual relationship.

Jurors heard she didn't even believe she and 44-year-old Schubert would fit in the same bed.

But it's alleged the defendant raped the woman later that day in her own bedroom.

Schubert denies two counts of rape and two counts of sexual assault by penetration.

Oxford Crown Court heard though the man described himself on Match.com as a "big cuddly bear looking for his mate". He also allegedly used pictures on the site which disguised his size.

(Image: Ric Mellis/Hyde News & Pictures Ltd)

And jurors were told when the woman opened the door to Schubert on January 30 last year, the woman was disheartened.

"When he arrived, obviously I knew straight away that he didn't look like he did in his profile picture," the woman told Thames Valley Police officers.

"To be honest with you, I thought: 's***, you're huge. You're absolutely huge'," she told the police.

"I had already said we were not going to have sex. You end up getting to know someone over a cup of tea and I invited him in to be sociable. I thought he was going to have a cup of tea and chat."

(Image: Ric Mellis/Hyde News & Pictures Ltd)

Prior to Schubert's arrival, the woman told the police, they had discussed sleeping in the same bed if he came over to her house but she had said nothing would happen and she would wear her pyjamas.

The woman added: "Given his size, we would not have fitted comfortably in the same bed. There is personal space and there is personal space. Even if I had a king size bed...I'd have no personal space at all. I'd have nowhere to go.

"There had already been a conversation. He had invited me over to his and he had a king size bed. I said to him that if I felt comfortable I'd sleep in a king size bed, but I'd have my personal space.

"When he arrived and I saw his size I just thought: 'There is absolutely no way. I said I did not know he was as big as what he was. Literally'. It doesn't stop me liking someone because of his size but it was never my intention to sleep with him."

(Image: PA Archive/Press Association Images)

Schubert, from St Neots, Cambridgeshire, had chatted up the complainant through Match.com messages where he told her about how he earned a living selling "designer clothes, shoes, anything I can get my hands on" over online auctioneering marketplace, eBay.

She told officers he was "morbidly obese" in appearance and that he was so large his tee-shirt didn't cover his stomach.

The defendant, on trial accused of two counts of rape and two counts of sexual assault by penetration, sat wearing a dark coloured blazer and tee-shirt as he listened to the chat history between him and the complainant being read out before the jury and Judge Nigel Daly.

The trial continues.
description: Christopher Schubert, described as a "big, cuddly bear", met the woman on dating site Match.com and then visited her home in Oxfordshire
